The Marmara Taksim Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 190 reviews

the marmara hotel is a very comfortable hotel, undergoing renovation until about march 2011. it benefits from fantastic views over the bosphorus and the city and is on taksin square.

the rooms are reasonable in size, though not enormous with very good wireless internet connections. all are comfortably furnished with decent bathrooms. breakfast is excellent and served at the rooftop restuarant with superb views. the staff are pleasant and professional.

Show more
Michael , United Kingdom
Shangri-La Bosphorus Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 48 reviews

Everything was great food, location, service etc. The room size was AMAZING for the centre of Istanbul almost 70msq and we felt like it was a suite even though it was the entry level room.

The spa was terrific! The location was perfect. As with all chinese hotels it was a little soulless but very grand but considering the intensity and texture of istanbul it actually felt like a sanctuary away from personality which worked really well and felt genius. You can go along the Bosphorus to the 4seasons and Kempinski which are much grander and have better food/leisure options - all walking distance. I stay in hotels 75% of my life and only 10% of them I'd say that I'd love to go back - this is one of the good ones.

Show more
Alex , United Kingdom
Sura Hagia Sophia Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 186 reviews

The hotel is literally located at the centre of the Old City. (a) Room size - I personally find it "small" given that this property has gone through a refurbishment.

(b) Breakfast - This is the one item I need to compliment. The spread is awesome and the selection is fabulous. We never failed to look forward to breakfast. (c) Location - Very convenient as you literally could walk to most attractions. We did walk most of the times as the weather was pleasant. Only issue encountered when the taxi driver could not get to the hotel due to roadwork. As we could not speak the language and the taxi driver literally dumped us by the roadside as through the hand sign we understand there is no other alternatives. We called the hotel but the instructions weren't clear. Took us a while to locate the hotel with our luggage in tow...... what a luck if you encounter the same road work and they can't send you to the hotel doorstep. (d) Nearby shops - Beware, these guys selling carpets and rugs will try their luck as much cash from you as possible. I was shocked to be offered a piece of carpet at the start price of US$3,500. I wasn't convinced as I was shocked. Hence, I just played along and towards the end when they have enough of me (yes, as I had nothing much to do that particular evening, I spent 3.5 hours at the shop as they didn't want to let me go unless I buy something!!!!!). For the same piece, I told them I do not see any value to it and the most I will offer US$200. The seller made his assistant "running" to their boss few time (they claimed the boss is located at another branch) and came back with good news, there is a deal. Wow from US$3,500 to US$200? Well, since it is a gentleman agreement, I paid the US$200 and left the shop wondering what have I got myself into. Hence, beware.

Show more
Woon , Malaysia
CVK Park Bosphorus Hotel Istanbul
8.6 Excellent
Based on 177 reviews

New hotel, centrally located with very nice decoration. The rooms are very clean, spacious with Turkish style furniture .

The bathroom is wide, clean, with a Turkish hammam inside the bathroom that I find very interesting. All the amenities are there( shampoo, conditioner , showe gel, body lotion, dental kit, shaving kit, make up kit, shower cap, nail file , soap. And all of good quality. The staff are helpful except concierge !!! I would come back to this hotel and recommend it to friends .

Show more
Huda , Saudi Arabia
Swissotel The Bosphorus Istanbul Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 167 reviews

Staying in swissotel was one of my Luxurious experiences in the life. It is an amazing hotel with nice view of Bosphorus which rock your socks when you enter the lobby.

It has a nice swimming pool and amazing (expensive ;) restaurant. Rooms are very clean and they make your rooms up at least 2 times a day. The Location is green and calm but you have to get taxi to anywhere or walk at least couple of kilometers to the nearest tram station (which is Kabatash). The taxi however doesn't cost more than 5-6 TL from the hotel to kabatash. And a tram take you to the Sultanahmet area with 1.5 TL. If you are in istanbul for couple of days and for sightseeing I don't reccomment this hotel since you better get something near sultanahmet area which is near to everywhere. The main problem in this hotel in my opinion was the fact that you need to pay 20 Euros per day for using the Internet. which was totally nonsense when every single hostel has it for free.

Show more
Javad , Finland
Hilton Istanbul Bomonti Hotel and Conference Center
8.7 Excellent
Based on 259 reviews

it was ok, and i am not saying bad things about anything or any one here, i criticize the hotel and part of its management.

..its not really a bad one, im sure others had better experience, but thats the point if you are a great hotel there should be quality consistency throughout...i should be happy so as for everyone else..., but not comfortable, staff wise ok, they seem a bit solid...wall socket is out of place, as in dangling with wires and stuff, floor not clean, garbage under TV table from previous customers, toilet seat is so dirty to the point that yellow spots are imprinted on the seat! whether you clean it with whatever or not..! that was in both rooms we took. we were charged for items in the fridge that we never even opened..they said that my brother used it, in fact they should say items were taken from there, but in no way they can say your brother took something!...when i was upset, they quickly said oh it was our mistake!Air-conditioning! ....you cannot change it, you cannot tamper with it...warm! i wake up sweating! Room lights turn off and i had to call a technician to come and it turned out that it was a switch in the wall that only the tech can open for the room's electricity to be back..room cleaning if its messy, takes about5 mints, not because the housekeeping is good but coz i have seen how it is cleaned...seems that it is more of chore rather than a job with customer satisfaction in mind.. Reception...i dont know why are staff is pissed! but of course they act professional, but as a customer you can tell if the person in front of you is stressed, angry and holding it or over worked and it is only when you feel that there is anger in the air you dont feel comfy at all ...and not form one or two ..all is fine with me if i were alone, but for a family two rooms? nope... another thing, but was a good experience turkish people are great people not going there again, coz i went there for fun and relaxing not running into obstacles.

Show more
Amro , Saudi Arabia
Ayasultan Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 233 reviews

It's a small hotel in great location, near Blue Moscque, with lots of restaurantes near by. From Attaturk Airport you can easily reach the hotel with metro, which will take one hour, but with a price of cca 6€.

Rooms with double separate beds are smaller and don't have a view to the street, but those which have one big bed does have a big window/door lookin at the street which is not noisy. It's cozy and cute, and for 3 star hotel it's fine. They have breakfast on the roof, and if you are traveling during winter, it's cold. Some guests were complaning about coldness, and I think that rooms from 3. floor are 'added', so they didn't make a good instalations there. If you are not going to spend too much time in you rooms, this hotel will be ok. Breakfast is the same each day..and if you are vegetarian then you will have only cornflakes and fruit to eat. Don't know what's the taste of meat-salami products. Friendly stuff.

Show more
ADRIANA , Croatia
Elite World Europe Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 38 reviews

Pierre Loti Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 58 reviews

The hotel location was brilliant, just few minutes from all tourist attraction. The hotel was clean, the guest relation lady and few of the reception staff were very good but few staff not as helpful.

I found the breakfast very basic and no variety. Breakfast staff very not very polite and kept taking everything whilst we still eating, as they wanted to get rid. The bed in the room was very small, I've had better quality and size of beds in other hotel. The layout of room not to sink with the sink in room rather with toilet or bath

Show more
faizal , United Kingdom
Ciragan Palace Kempinski Istanbul Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 53 reviews

I cannot rate the Kempinski highly enough. I have stayed at a Kempinski Hotel before and remember the quality of service standing out, it did again as nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff.

The location however and the 16th Century backdrop of the original palace make the stay so special. The view of the Bosphorus from our room, the swimming pool, The restaurants and the gardens of the hotel lift the experience to spectacular. The food was amazing in all the restaurants that we tried, breakfast having a real wow factor in that the selection of food types on offer was vast. My son and I will definitely stay at the Ciragan Palace Kempinski again and we will try and do it soon.

Show more
Nicola , United Kingdom
Divan Istanbul Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 64 reviews

The standard of customer service and staff care shown by the Divan hotel is of an enormously superior standard to what you would find elsewhere in the city.

From being met by the concierge to check-in and beyond, service is smooth and extremely efficient. The staff-training has clearly been very carefully managed and this shows. This means that the first-impression is favourable and easily maintained throughout one's stay. The hotel is located just behind Taksim square and very close to the metro station and Istiklal street, through which one can easily access the Galata district and other transport. A superlative hotel.

Show more
Gary , United Kingdom
Hotel Arcadia Blue Istanbul
8.6 Excellent
Based on 166 reviews

My husband & I were in a 6th floor seaview room, while our friends chose a standard room which was on the same floor.

Both rooms were commodious, with comfortable beds, responsive climate controls, and a fine 'rain' shower in the bath. But we were SO glad we spent the relatively modest extra for our "seaview" room!! Each time we entered it, from first to last, we were astonished and exhilarated to find ourselves looking directly at the Blue Mosque! Night and day, the view was unbelievably spectacular; and the windows opened easily if we wanted to hear the calls to prayers. The location was perfect, on a broad, quiet street where we could turn left and walk a short, level block to a busy street with restaurants, shops, and the tram. We could also turn right, walk a quarter block, turn left and down a block to the Hippodrome. The front desk staff as well as the porters were very welcoming. The rooftop restaurant where we enjoyed our buffet breakfasts, as well as a glass of happy-hour wine and delicious snacks each afternoon, also was staffed by cordial servers. When we asked for a taxi to be called on our last night so we could meet our Turkish friends at a restaurant, the desk clerk recognized the name of the restaurant immediately. Unfortunately, it had moved to a new locale around the corner and down a block from the old place, so when the taxi dropped us off, we had a little hassle trying to find it (a bus full of police happened to be in front of the old site and had absolutely no idea where we wanted to go!) But later, arriving back at Acadia Blue, when I told the same desk clerk (I'm sorry I don't recall his name), about the mix-up, he graciously and sincerely thanked me for updating his personal knowledge so he would be prepared to assist future guests who might want to go to this notable restaurant. A few other reviews mentioned a foul odor in the bathrooms, but I'm glad to report our rooms had no such problem! We will happily return here again!

Show more
Lori , United States
Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus
8.4 Excellent
Based on 106 reviews

It was my first time in Hilton Istanbul. First night I was given a room on the lower ground floor overlooking a park but with a busy and noisy street overhead.

Had to take 2 different lifts, and walk a mile to get to my room. It was incredibly noisy all night from the outside, not exactly the hotel's fault but the double glazing was just not good enough. Naturally, I complained the next morning. Young lad at reception was very nice and helpful in stark contrast to the young lady the day before. He gave me a free upgrade to a room with a view on the 4th floor. The view was amazing, the balconies from every room are great. The decor overall is tired but the rooms are a good size. When the weather is good, this hotel is ideal because of the outdoor pool. It's like being on a holiday resort in the middle of a very busy city Great location too, with a 5-10 minute walk to Taksim and Beyoglu. Would recommend only if you get a room with a view.

Show more
Oya , United Kingdom
InterContinental Istanbul
8.3 Excellent
Based on 118 reviews

its better to runaway from this hotel if you need a more size room. The location is very good, easy access to the taksim square.

i come here during the winter at 3rd-5th of January 2011, the air conditioner in room is automatically off and turn into a heater. In this small room, is very hot when you turn off the heater and the windows are closed. I asked them can we set the heater into air conditioner and they say it cant. If you want they will let the house keeping to open my window. And when opening the window its been very cold in my room.

Show more
HENRY , Indonesia
Conrad Istanbul Bosphorus
8.5 Excellent
Based on 95 reviews

We were on a 16 day land tour of Turkey and the tour company booked us into the Conrad for the first night and the last two nights.

Due to flights, we got there two days earlier and stayed one day later. This allowed us five spectacular days in Istanbul. This is truly a five star hotel i.e. Obama stayed there approximately two months prior to our visit. Hotel initially appears to be out of the way but is extremely convenient to everything you want to see and do. In a taxi and for approximately $8 U.S. (don't take it from the hotel but rather walk across the street and hail one i.e. much less expensive)you are in the old city or you can take the metro there for approx. $1 U.S. per person. In the vicinity of the hotel, there is excellent dining down the hill and to your right in an entire maze of shopping and restaurants. Overral, a great experience if your are prepared to pay for it ENJOY

Show more
RALPH , Canada
Raffles Istanbul Hotel
9.6 Exceptional
Based on 9 reviews

Titanic Port Bakirkoy
8.5 Excellent
Based on 56 reviews

this hotel is the best option near the airport with regards to price versus quality. much better even than the well known sheraton which is situated almost next to the hotel.

i used to stay at the airport marriott and sheraton, but i will stay at the titanic from now on. nice breakfast, great spa area and fitness, good room service, very nice room that are very low in price in comparison to other options nearby. the standard rooms are new, big and almost coming close to a suite.

Show more
Rogier , Netherlands
Wyndham Grand Istanbul Levent
8.3 Excellent
Based on 19 reviews

Radisson Blu Hotel Istanbul Sisli
8.5 Excellent
Based on 34 reviews

Elite World Istanbul Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 119 reviews

Our stay was a mixed experience. The staff was very nice and helpful when we have questions about where to go.

The breakfast selection was delicious. The hotel was suppose to be located in a better part of town, however, my wife still felt a bit unsafe. Perhaps because it was winter and the gets dark quickly. The room itself was very small. With 2 luggages and a double, there was not much space left. Within walking distance of the major shopping street but amazingly crowded for how cold it was. Despite that, loads of people meandering and loittering. Interesting experience. Got scammed 50% of the time riding taxis with either meters that go very fast, or driver claiming I gave him a 5 when I gave a 50. Oh well.

Show more
Stephen , United States
Elite World Business Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 106 reviews

I was travelling with my kids. We got two big modern and clean rooms. Air conditions worked well, beds were comfortable, tv multimedia channels were fine.

Spa, gym and swimming pool area is almost perfect. Breakfast was tasty covering hot and cold meals, fruits, vegetables, cakes, juices, dry fruits, yoghurts..so basicaly everybody can choose their desired meals. Overall service and approach of the staff is on high level. In my view there are few minor things that hotel could improve in order to deserve really " 5 stars ". First of all I really missed Automatic Coffee Machine, even 3-stars hotels have these machines and you can prepare your favourite cappucino, hot chocolate, latte etc. Because the coffee that was served was not tasty and cold. Based on my request capuccino and hot chocolate drink for my kids were served to us for 4 morning but then we were told by one waiter that this is " extra " and we have to pay for that. By chance this was the only person in that hotel that lacked nice behaviour. Further I would like to advice the hotel to replace the standard mini-bottles of shower gel, shampoo and hair conditioners by something of better quality. And the last point is regarding the chlorine in the swimming pool, on our last night when enjoying the swimming we noticed more concentration of chlorine in the water to the extent where my little son's skin showed big allergy spots. The last point I need to say is that the hotel is located far from the city centre and right by the inner highway. There is not much to do in the neighbourhood. We had Instanbul Pass so daily took the Metrobus (station is located cca 300m) with combination with Metro or Tramway to travel and explore the city...overall it is matter of cca 22 stops to get to main attractions. So if you a traveller that is not that much comfortable to take these long journes in public transportation...I would advice you to book hotel close to Sultan Ahmet and Topkapi area.

Show more
Zmaray , Czech Republic
Hilton Istanbul Kozyatagi
8.3 Excellent
Based on 56 reviews

Armada Istanbul Old City Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 153 reviews

Both my wife and I were impressed with the hotel, its location and level of customer service. The rooftop terrace, from which breakfast is available alongside a covered restaurant area, offers 3 iconic views from every table - the Blue Mosque; Hagia Sofia; and the Sea of Marmara.

The hotel is located on a small quiet street just across the road from the coastal road (putting it in easy access from the airport) within the old fortress walls. A 10-15 minute uphill walk takes you to the central attractions of the Sultanahmet area ('Old Town')and through the few streets which make up one of the lively restaurant/entertainment areas of this part of town. We found the best meals served at the Lady Diana restaurant, just below the blue Mosque/Aghia Sofia area; and the Medusa restaurant, just north of the basilica cistern entrance. The city abounds with 'must-see' areas from the old viaduct to the Grand Bazaar and many elaborate mosques. Comfortable walking shoes are a must!

Show more
Graham , United Kingdom
Elite World Prestige Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 31 reviews

The Grand Tarabya Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 46 reviews

Better then expected, perfect location. Rooms are amazing. High class hotel. Bosphorus view is inglorious.

Best choice in istanbul. Will be there again very soon, i hope.

Show more
yigit , Turkey
Ramada Plaza Istanbul City Center
8.2 Excellent
Based on 69 reviews

we had a good time and we had enjoyed our stay. it's been a few days since our stay at the hotel. my family wanted to thank all of you for the wonderful accommodations and service.

i think it is by far the best hotel we've stayed in. not only is the hotel beautiful, the staff was warm and helpful to us-especially not speaking the language, it was a comfort to know we could communicate well, and we appreciated the time we spent the hotel. it is suggested to visit the hotel all worthwhile. we will tell everyone we know who will visit istanbul to spend their days at this hotel. hope to be back soon! thank you once again, salem

Show more
Salem , Saudi Arabia
Vialand Palace Amusement Park Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 50 reviews

Titanic Business Kartal
8.5 Excellent
Based on 66 reviews

Point Hotel Taksim
7.5 Very good
Based on 57 reviews

As the hotel is on the hill, the view was amazing even from the fourth floor, but it probably depends on the side your room will be.

My room was very calm -- being a light sleeper, I usually can't have windows open due to street noise, but here it was fine. The worst noise was the "signing" seagulls. The style is quite interesting -- I liked the feeling of 1950's. Still, everything was either new or really well renovated. Was shocked to find a free cell phone in the room with unlimited local calls and internet -- if I didn't have my local sim, I would certainly appreciate this! Not sure if it is available in all rooms (mine was superior twin). The location of the hotel is quite convenient, 10 min walk from Cevahir mall and Sisli metro station; there are plenty of shops and small restaurants in the are

Show more
badr , Saudi Arabia
Gezi Hotel Bosphorus
8.5 Excellent
Based on 191 reviews

Good location is the main reason why we picked this hotel, it being close to Taksim Square. It was listed as a boutique hotel and rated five star.

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay, this being our first visit to Istanbul. The downside- hotel lobby is very small, similar to lodge type accommodation. Constantinopole is a chaotic, mega-city, with numerous available hotels and apartments to choose from to stay.

Therefore, it seemed not an easy decision to make. However, choosing to stay at Meroddi Pera Hotel just proved to be a right decision. Located in a narrow, quiet passage only 40 meters parallel to Istiklal street, heading downhill towards Galata Tower (200 meters) and Karakoy bay, is easy to find and close to all means of transportation. Sishane metro station is 300 meters uphill, with connection to Ataturk airport (50 minutes journey). Buses and trams leave from Karakoy, right next to Galata Bridge, ferries, by far the best way to explore the city, depart from Karakoy Bay. Once wandering around on foot is preferred, this a right place to stay. Many sights of interest lie within walking distance, with magnificent views and numerous cafes, restaurants and shops around. Not to miss, definitely, is breakfast! It is offered in a place right next door to the property, with choices more than enough to begin the day. Scrambled eggs and orange juice made of freshly squeezed oranges easily match any 5 star accommodation. Room was clean with a queen double, very comfortable bed, wooden floor, minibar, bottled water offered for free and shower with a marble floor. View is nothing special, but had windows towards three directions. Area looked safe, reception is 24/7 available. Great value for money, indeed. Recommended, would stay again.

Istanbul is a great place to begin looking at European history. There are so many historical landmarks it is not possible to list them.

The tram will take you most places around the old city and taxis are reasonable - make them use the meter - don't negotiate. More about Istanbul

With one foot in Europe and the other in Asia, Istanbul is a beautiful enigma. Founded by the Greeks, developed by the Romans and Byzantines, and perfected under the Ottomans, Istanbul has more than enough history, architecture, and culture.

Hotels in Istanbul range from ultra-modern high rises to cozy inns housed in restored heritage buildings. Across the water from Sirkeci and Sultanahmet on the Antolian side of the Bosporus is the Kadikoy-Uskudar area where historic trams clatter past shoppers.

It's impossible to visit Istanbul without standing in awe of the city’s stunning art and architecture. The Sultanahmet historic quarter is awash with Byzantine-era homes and Ottoman mosques. Its crowning attraction is Hagia Sophia, a grand basilica-turned-mosque-turned-museum that was once the world's largest enclosed space.

Culture comes in many forms on this continental bridge. Beyoglu-Taksim district boasts museums and art galleries, stages Jazz festivals, and operates several top-end boutiques. Trendy night clubs and bohemian cafés huddle around the boutique hotels in Istanbul, and of course a trip to Istanbul would not be complete without a visit to the Grand Bazaar.

Sirkeci Station is the point of entry for travelers arriving by rail from Europe, but most visitors arrive via Ataturk Airport on the European side. It's a well-run facility with links to cities across Europe and the Middle East.

There’s much more to see and learn about Istanbul, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

Show more Michael , United Kingdom Shangri-La Bosphorus Hotel 9.1 Exceptional Based on 48 reviews Everything was great food, location, service etc. The room size was AMAZING for the centre of Istanbul almost 70msq and we felt like it was a suite even though it was the entry level room. The spa was terrific! The location was perfect. As with all chinese hotels it was a little soulless but very grand but considering the intensity and texture of istanbul it actually felt like a sanctuary away from personality which worked really well and felt genius. You can go along the Bosphorus to the 4seasons and Kempinski which are much grander and have better food/leisure options - all walking distance. I stay in hotels 75% of my life and only 10% of them I'd say that I'd love to go back - this is one of the good ones. Show more Alex , United Kingdom Sura Hagia Sophia Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 186 reviews The hotel is literally located at the centre of the Old City. (a) Room size - I personally find it "small" given that this property has gone through a refurbishment. (b) Breakfast - This is the one item I need to compliment. The spread is awesome and the selection is fabulous. We never failed to look forward to breakfast. (c) Location - Very convenient as you literally could walk to most attractions. We did walk most of the times as the weather was pleasant. Only issue encountered when the taxi driver could not get to the hotel due to roadwork. As we could not speak the language and the taxi driver literally dumped us by the roadside as through the hand sign we understand there is no other alternatives. We called the hotel but the instructions weren't clear. Took us a while to locate the hotel with our luggage in tow...... what a luck if you encounter the same road work and they can't send you to the hotel doorstep. (d) Nearby shops - Beware, these guys selling carpets and rugs will try their luck as much cash from you as possible. I was shocked to be offered a piece of carpet at the start price of US$3,500. I wasn't convinced as I was shocked. Hence, I just played along and towards the end when they have enough of me (yes, as I had nothing much to do that particular evening, I spent 3.5 hours at the shop as they didn't want to let me go unless I buy something!!!!!). For the same piece, I told them I do not see any value to it and the most I will offer US$200. The seller made his assistant "running" to their boss few time (they claimed the boss is located at another branch) and came back with good news, there is a deal. Wow from US$3,500 to US$200? Well, since it is a gentleman agreement, I paid the US$200 and left the shop wondering what have I got myself into. Hence, beware. The taxi however doesn't cost more than 5-6 TL from the hotel to kabatash. And a tram take you to the Sultanahmet area with 1.5 TL. If you are in istanbul for couple of days and for sightseeing I don't reccomment this hotel since you better get something near sultanahmet area which is near to everywhere. The main problem in this hotel in my opinion was the fact that you need to pay 20 Euros per day for using the Internet. which was totally nonsense when every single hostel has it for free. Room lights turn off and i had to call a technician to come and it turned out that it was a switch in the wall that only the tech can open for the room's electricity to be back..room cleaning if its messy, takes about5 mints, not because the housekeeping is good but coz i have seen how it is cleaned...seems that it is more of chore rather than a job with customer satisfaction in mind.. Reception...i dont know why are staff is pissed! but of course they act professional, but as a customer you can tell if the person in front of you is stressed, angry and holding it or over worked and it is only when you feel that there is anger in the air you dont feel comfy at all ...and not form one or two ..all is fine with me if i were alone, but for a family two rooms? nope... another thing, but was a good experience turkish people are great people not going there again, coz i went there for fun and relaxing not running into obstacles. Show more Gary , United Kingdom Hotel Arcadia Blue Istanbul 8.6 Excellent Based on 166 reviews My husband & I were in a 6th floor seaview room, while our friends chose a standard room which was on the same floor. Both rooms were commodious, with comfortable beds, responsive climate controls, and a fine 'rain' shower in the bath. But we were SO glad we spent the relatively modest extra for our "seaview" room!! Each time we entered it, from first to last, we were astonished and exhilarated to find ourselves looking directly at the Blue Mosque! Night and day, the view was unbelievably spectacular; and the windows opened easily if we wanted to hear the calls to prayers. The location was perfect, on a broad, quiet street where we could turn left and walk a short, level block to a busy street with restaurants, shops, and the tram. We could also turn right, walk a quarter block, turn left and down a block to the Hippodrome. The front desk staff as well as the porters were very welcoming. The rooftop restaurant where we enjoyed our buffet breakfasts, as well as a glass of happy-hour wine and delicious snacks each afternoon, also was staffed by cordial servers. When we asked for a taxi to be called on our last night so we could meet our Turkish friends at a restaurant, the desk clerk recognized the name of the restaurant immediately. Unfortunately, it had moved to a new locale around the corner and down a block from the old place, so when the taxi dropped us off, we had a little hassle trying to find it (a bus full of police happened to be in front of the old site and had absolutely no idea where we wanted to go!) But later, arriving back at Acadia Blue, when I told the same desk clerk (I'm sorry I don't recall his name), about the mix-up, he graciously and sincerely thanked me for updating his personal knowledge so he would be prepared to assist future guests who might want to go to this notable restaurant. A few other reviews mentioned a foul odor in the bathrooms, but I'm glad to report our rooms had no such problem! We will happily return here again! It was incredibly noisy all night from the outside, not exactly the hotel's fault but the double glazing was just not good enough. Naturally, I complained the next morning. Air conditions worked well, beds were comfortable, tv multimedia channels were fine. Spa, gym and swimming pool area is almost perfect. Breakfast was tasty covering hot and cold meals, fruits, vegetables, cakes, juices, dry fruits, yoghurts..so basicaly everybody can choose their desired meals. Overall service and approach of the staff is on high level. In my view there are few minor things that hotel could improve in order to deserve really " 5 stars ". First of all I really missed Automatic Coffee Machine, even 3-stars hotels have these machines and you can prepare your favourite cappucino, hot chocolate, latte etc. Because the coffee that was served was not tasty and cold. Based on my request capuccino and hot chocolate drink for my kids were served to us for 4 morning but then we were told by one waiter that this is " extra " and we have to pay for that. The last point I need to say is that the hotel is located far from the city centre and right by the inner highway. There is not much to do in the neighbourhood. Located in a narrow, quiet passage only 40 meters parallel to Istiklal street, heading downhill towards Galata Tower (200 meters) and Karakoy bay, is easy to find and close to all means of transportation. Sishane metro station is 300 meters uphill, with connection to Ataturk airport (50 minutes journey). Buses and trams leave from Karakoy, right next to Galata Bridge, ferries, by far the best way to explore the city, depart from Karakoy Bay. Once wandering around on foot is preferred, this a right place to stay. Many sights of interest lie within walking distance, with magnificent views and numerous cafes, restaurants and shops around. Not to miss, definitely, is breakfast! It is offered in a place right next door to the property, with choices more than enough to begin the day. Scrambled eggs and orange juice made of freshly squeezed oranges easily match any 5 star accommodation. Room was clean with a queen double, very comfortable bed, wooden floor, minibar, bottled water offered for free and shower with a marble floor. View is nothing special, but had windows towards three directions. Area looked safe, reception is 24/7 available. Great value for money, indeed. Recommended, would stay again. Abdul Majid ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of Istanbul Beyoglu 1006 hotels Sultanahmet 577 hotels Fatih 410 hotels Sisli 407 hotels Besiktas 151 hotels Laleli 140 hotels Beyazit 135 hotels Buyukcekmece 123 hotels Kadikoy 121 hotels Sirkeci 112 hotels Bakirkoy 91 hotels Pendik 77 hotels Atasehir 57 hotels Eyup 51 hotels Kucukcekmece 45 hotels Esenyurt 44 hotels Bahcelievler 39 hotels Avcilar 38 hotels Kartal 36 hotels Basaksehir 34 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Istanbul 830 Serviced Apartments in Istanbul 478 Guest Houses in Istanbul 274 Hostels in Istanbul 97 More about Istanbul With one foot in Europe and the other in Asia, Istanbul is a beautiful enigma. Founded by the Greeks, developed by the Romans and Byzantines, and perfected under the Ottomans, Istanbul has more than enough history, architecture, and culture. Hotels in Istanbul range from ultra-modern high rises to cozy inns housed in restored heritage buildings. Across the water from Sirkeci and Sultanahmet on the Antolian side of the Bosporus is the Kadikoy-Uskudar area where historic trams clatter past shoppers. It's impossible to visit Istanbul without standing in awe of the city’s stunning art and architecture. The Sultanahmet historic quarter is awash with Byzantine-era homes and Ottoman mosques. Its crowning attraction is Hagia Sophia , a grand basilica-turned-mosque-turned-museum that was once the world's largest enclosed space. Culture comes in many forms on this continental bridge. Beyoglu-Taksim district boasts museums and art galleries, stages Jazz festivals, and operates several top-end boutiques. Trendy night clubs and bohemian cafés huddle around the boutique hotels in Istanbul, and of course a trip to Istanbul would not be complete without a visit to the Grand Bazaar . Sirkeci Station is the point of entry for travelers arriving by rail from Europe, but most visitors arrive via Ataturk Airport on the European side. It's a well-run facility with links to cities across Europe and the Middle East. There’s much more to see and learn about Istanbul, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
